title: Chaos Elemental/Strategies

properties.name: description
properties.value: Fighting the Chaos Elemental is a matter of countering its unequip attack by keeping your inventory full and avoiding player killers. As it attacks with random damage types, you will always be taking damage unless you are flinching. Therefore, it is critical to maximize the amount of healing you bring while minimizing your risk. Dragonhide armour is effective. Always check your Items Kept on Death before fighting this boss, and never bring anything you are not willing to lose.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Chaos Elemental/Strategies
A group of players take on the Chaos Elemental.
Chaos Elemental's location.

Fighting the Chaos Elemental is a matter of countering its unequip attack by keeping your inventory full and avoiding player killers. As it attacks with random damage types, you will always be taking damage unless you are flinching. Therefore, it is critical to maximize the amount of healing you bring while minimizing your risk. Dragonhide armour is effective. Always check your Items Kept on Death before fighting this boss, and never bring anything you are not willing to lose.

Contents

  • 1 Getting there
  • 2 Countering the Unequip Attack
  • 3 Solo
  • 4 Team
  • 5 Suggested skills
  • 6 Equipment
  • 7 Avoiding and escaping player killers

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • From Edgeville bank, run south and pull the lever. Bring a knife or slash weapon to cut the web, then run east past the Resource Area and Scorpion Pit (avoid running through it).
  • From Mage Arena bank, pull the lever and cut the two webs. Continue running east.
  • After using Annakarl Teleport or Annakarl teleport (tablet), run north-west along the fence until you see the gate. Pass through it and run north-east. Requires completion of Desert Treasure.
  • If you have completed the hard Wilderness Diary, you can teleport to the Wilderness Obelisk (Level 50) to get there quickly from the level 13 obelisk near the Ferox Enclave. This is generally the best option, as it does not require any items and is the shortest.

Countering the Unequip Attack[edit | edit source]

One of the three attacks the elemental may use will unequip up to four of your currently equipped items back to your inventory, prioritizing your weapon. This attack leaves you vulnerable to future attacks, costs time when reequipping, and can distract you from looking out for PKers. Rangers may be dragged into melee range when their weapon is unequipped. By keeping your inventory full, this attack will not have any effect.

Bring consumables that leave an item behind and have high healing, such as summer pies (2 × 11 hitpoints, 2 × 10% run energy), curry (19 hitpoints), and Guthix rest (4 × 5 hitpoints, 4 × 5% run energy). Potions like Saradomin brews will leave a vial behind unless you have talked to the Barbarian guard and enabled automatic vial smashing (you can use NPC Contact to disable this).

If such consumables are unavailable, it is also viable to bring one or two sacks of potatoes, cabbages, or onions to fill your inventory dynamically. Each time you create an empty space by eating food, immediately empty/remove-one vegetable from the sack to fill the empty space. Fill the sack when picking up loot, then empty it again before reengaging. Finally, you can also eat the raw vegetables in a pinch, as they each heal 1 hitpoint.

It may be helpful to remember that the Chaos Elemental will always drop at least two items when killed, often three or more. Be wary of storing items in the Looting bag, as they cannot be removed and may leave you with empty spaces.

Solo[edit | edit source]

The dead trees at the south-west tip of Rogues' Castle can be used to flinch.

The safest method for soloing it would be taking advantage of the hit-and-hide tactic (also referred to as flinching or hit-and-run) with the usage of nearby trees. This can be done by attracting the Chaos Elemental's attention, and then immediately running behind a tree so it can't attack you. Wait for its Hitpoint bar to disappear, hit it once, and run back behind the tree. Repeat until the elemental is dead. This method can be done with any Melee weapon. A full set of Verac's equipment is recommended for fast kills, but you WILL risk the Verac's helm if you get smited by a PK team.

If not using the hit-and-hide tactic, using a Karil's leathertop, Verac's helm and plateskirt with a Crystal shield or Dragonfire shield and a Rune crossbow or Armadyl crossbow with Ruby bolts (e) makes this boss very easy to kill, even at sub-100 Combat levels, but beware of the risk. As there's a strong chance to encounter player killers, it would be better to stick to lower-cost gear to alleviate the risk.

Team[edit | edit source]

Players fighting with Melee should take armour with high Ranged and Melee Defence, such as Dragon or Barrows equipment, and use Protect from Magic. As there's a strong chance to encounter player killers, it would be better to stick to lower-cost gear to alleviate the risk.

Suggested skills[edit | edit source]

  • 80+
  • 80+
  • 70+
  • 75+
  • 37+ (70 Recommended)

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Activate Protect from Magic and Protect Item if high risk, or just use the safespot. Regardless, it's best to employ Protect Item for 4-iteming. After killing the Chaos Elemental, pick up the loot and bank if needed, and don't linger in the same world for too long as there's a high chance to encounter player killers.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Dragon dagger (p++) or Dragon halberd
  • 1 Divine super combat potion or Super set
  • 2-3 Prayer potions
  • Looting bag (optional)
  • Curry as food so your items do not get unequipped

Activate Protect from Magic and Protect Item if high risk, or just use the safespot. Regardless, it's best to employ Protect Item for 4-iteming. After killing the Chaos Elemental, pick up the loot and bank if needed, and don't linger in the same world for too long as there's a high chance to encounter player killers.

  • Dragon dagger (p++) or Dragon halberd
  • 1 Divine super combat potion or Super set
  • 2-3 Prayer potions
  • Looting bag (optional)
  • High-healing food like curry or summer pies

Activate Protect from Magic and Protect Item if high risk, or just use the safespot. Don't linger in the same world for too long as there's a high chance to encounter player killers.

  1. ^ Craw's bow is very slightly better in performance compared to the twisted bow, but due to it consuming ether, it is significantly more expensive and risky to use. However, it is also significantly cheaper to obtain than the twisted bow.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Divine ranging potion
  • 3-5 Prayer potions
  • Looting bag (optional)
  • High-healing food like curry or summer pies
  • Optionally, you can bring a Ring of wealth (i) switch for a doubled chance at a Clue scroll (elite).

Avoiding and escaping player killers[edit | edit source]

Due to the Chaos Elemental's location in multi-combat deep Wilderness, you will likely encounter player killers in both teams and as individuals. The nearby Rogues' Castle is useful for attackers to hop worlds (sometimes using low-level scouts) and spot potential victims, as the projectiles are visible beyond normal viewing range. It may be effective to switch worlds between kills to potentially avoid PKers and skip the respawn time.

If you are spotted and/or attacked, quickly select and pursue an escape option:

  • A Wilderness Obelisk (Level 50) lies on the south-east side of the Rogues' Castle. By default the obelisks' destination is random, but it is likely you will be teleported to relative safety such as single-way combat or a lower wilderness level. Completing the hard Wilderness Diary allows you to select a destination (the level 13 obelisk being the safest, as it is close to the Ferox Enclave). Warning: You cannot use obelisks while under the effect of Tele Block.
  • The Rogues' Castle has many doorways and staircases that can be used to confuse and shake loose of an attacker. Moving unpredictably and closing doors behind you can buy you time to log out. This is less effective when being chased by a team.
  • The Resource Area to the west requires 7,500 to enter, or less depending on completion of the Wilderness Diary (6,000 for medium, 3,750 for hard, or 0 for elite). If your attacker(s) did not bring coins or lacks the elite diary perk, you can escape them here.
  • The Magic axe hut to the north-west requires a Lockpick to enter and 23 to enter. Although there are aggressive magic axes contained within which prevent you from logging out, it is in single-way combat. It is very likely that either you or your attacker will be attacked by an axe, which may allow you to X-log. There are also two entrances/exits, which can help you create space.
  • The Deserted Keep to the west has a teleport lever which can take you to Ardougne (or Edgeville, if the easy Wilderness Diary is completed). A web blocks the entrance, so bring a knife or slash weapon to open it. Warning: You cannot use the lever while under the effect of Tele Block.

If it isn't likely that you will survive, prioritize keeping your prayer points so that you can keep Protect Item active. If you run out of prayer restoration, it may be advisable to accept your fate rather than continue eating food, as taking damage allows your attackers to potentially smite you for your fourth valuable item. Consider bringing a Falador shield for a last-resort prayer restoration option, as it is free to reobtain. The Demonic Ruins to the south also passively restore 1 prayer point every 3 seconds, which may provide a slim chance of reactivating Protect Item.
